word_mean: 由腹板与面板组成的大型组合构件。

sentence.Network_en: Compatibility will require that the girder deflection at B be zero.
sentence.Network_cn: 根据协调性的要求,梁在B点的挠度应为零.

sentence.Network_en: Most often this involved a segment of a girder web.
sentence.Network_cn: 大多数出现在主渠腹板部分.

sentence.Network_en: The cross girder center segments of the bents were field bolted.
sentence.Network_cn: 构架横梁的中间段在工地用螺栓连接.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from gird in the archaic sense 'brace, strengthen'

entry.def: A girder is a long, thick piece of steel or iron that is used in the framework of buildings and bridges.

means.word_mean: 1. a beam made usually of steel; a main support in a structure

auth_sentence.content: He poked his shoe through a hole in a rotting girder, tore off a piece of rusty metal, and examined a crack in the concrete deck.
auth_sentence.res_content: He poked his shoe through a hole in a rotting girder, tore off a piece of rusty metal, and examined a crack in the concrete deck.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He poked his shoe through a hole in a rotting girder, tore off a piece of rusty metal, and examined a crack in the concrete deck.

auth_sentence.content: Shown an alternative version of the Dallas design, he questioned a girder that didn't appear to be supporting any weight.
auth_sentence.res_content: Shown an alternative version of the Dallas design, he questioned a girder that didn't appear to be supporting any weight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Shown an alternative version of the Dallas design, he questioned a girder that didn't appear to be supporting any weight.

auth_sentence.content: He was handcuffed and chained to an H-shaped iron girder which prevented him from moving, sitting up or bending over for 11 days.

sentences.en: The block is still just a skeleton of girders.
sentences.cn: 这片建筑还只是仅有主梁的骨架。
